title.narrative: Humanitarian aid to fight Ebola in two counties in Liberia.

description.narrative: Programa de ayuda humanitaria para la lucha contra el ébola en dos condados de LIBERIA :: Proyecto que pretende la contención e expansión del ébola, en una zona de gran vulnerabilidad, Costa de Marfil. Estas acciones son ejecutadas por voluntarios autóctonos formados, que trasmitirán el mensaje a poblaciones analfabetas de las zonas forestales rurales

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Humanitarian assistance, Finn Church Aid

description.narrative: In March 2014 a rapidly evolving outbreak of Ebola hemorrhagic fever started in forested areas of Guinea. The outbreak spread to Sierra Leone and Liberia. Epidemic was not known in the area and the resources to respond were weak. Finn Church Aid activities in Liberia include increasing public awareness of EVD to fight misinformation and improving hygiene standards in the communities. The geogrphical target is 40 communities in Nimba and Grand Gedeh counties. Total number of beneficiaries is over 40 000.

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)

description.narrative: The project aims at increasing the capacity of FCA?s southern partner organisations or FCA?s regional offices through the work of skilled volunteers, and to give operational programme support through expert volunteer deployment. In 2015, the focus will be on education sector in coordination with the Teachers without Borders network.The objectives of the project are twofold: 1. Increasing the capacities of FCA?s local partners and regional office according to the needs in the field. The expert volunteers wi ll focus on capacity building activities (workshops, trainings etc.), support and training of local staff and local communities. After analysing the needs, the local partner will set up a realistic capacity development trajectory. The project contributes t o enhancing the quality of FCA?s deployment capacity in different thematic fields and on programme level.2. Strengthening thematic expertise globally and in FinlandExpert volunteers will have the opportunity to engage in one of the selected partner organis ations? work in developing countries and gain relevant work experience. The aim is to send 5 volunteers for 6 months each, allowing the volunteers deepen the impact of their work. Through this volunteer programme FCA contributes to build capacity of future experts in different thematic sectors and serve FCAs roster of experts.In 2015, the thematic focus continues to be the Right to Education in coordination with the Teachers without Borders network. Most of the field offices have identified needs for educat ion specialists, but if needed, other specialists can also be recruited:East Africa: an agribusiness specialist or a teacherWest Africa: a teacher (when the Ebola threat has passed)Latin America and the Caribbean: a French-speaking education specialistAsia : an education specialist for the Cambodian Ministry of EducationMiddle East: an Arabic-speaking education specialist for a refugee campRights- holders /beneficiaries are teachers and staff working in e.g. training centers in refugee camps, vocational trai ning students, children in need of specialised education, farmers.Implementing partners:FCA regional offices and their local partners.

description.narrative: Healthsecurity -project with Ebola added while processing. Staff of POPDA DPO and experts from local hospital train PWDs, polio, amputees(war victims) and blind ones in three disabled camps how to avoid malari, cholera, typhoid and ebola. Local languages a nd drama are used. Medical inspections are made and adviced how to use health servicies. Radioprograms about UN Disability Convention Healt paragram are broadcasted. PWDs and their families learn to take care of their health and to demand equal health serv ices with other citizens. 200 PWDs area reached by the program.

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: WHO, Ebola Outbreak Immediate Response in West Africa (Guinea Liberia and Sierra Leone)

description.narrative: Outbreak of Ebola Virus Disease in Western Africa calls for immediate response interventions to be implemented in the affected countries Guinea Liberia and Sierra Leone in order not to become a global problem. The objective of the Action Plan for Ebola Out break Response of World Health Organization is to stop transmission of Ebola through effective and evidence-based outbreak control measures enhancinging coordination and collaboration of all health actors and scaling-up of human and financial resource mobi lization. WHO was mandated to step up its action to lead and coordinate the international response to the outbreak in the Ministerial Meeting in Accra 2-3 July 2014.

The Strategic Objectives of the UN System Response to the Ebola Outbreak are:1) Stop the outbreak2) Treat the infected3) Ensure essential services4) Preserve stability5) Prevent outbreaks in countries currently unaffected

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Capacity Building Through Voluntarism

description.narrative: The project aims at increasing the capacity of FCA?s southern partner organisations or FCA?s regional offices through the work of skilled volunteers, and to give operational programme support through expert volunteer deployment. In 2015, the focus will be on education sector in coordination with the Teachers without Borders network.The objectives of the project are twofold: 1. Increasing the capacities of FCA?s local partners and regional office according to the needs in the field. The expert volunteers wi ll focus on capacity building activities (workshops, trainings etc.), support and training of local staff and local communities. After analysing the needs, the local partner will set up a realistic capacity development trajectory. The project contributes t o enhancing the quality of FCA?s deployment capacity in different thematic fields and on programme level.2. Strengthening thematic expertise globally and in FinlandExpert volunteers will have the opportunity to engage in one of the selected partner organis ations? work in developing countries and gain relevant work experience. The aim is to send 5 volunteers for 6 months each, allowing the volunteers deepen the impact of their work. Through this volunteer programme FCA contributes to build capacity of future experts in different thematic sectors and serve FCAs roster of experts.In 2015, the thematic focus continues to be the Right to Education in coordination with the Teachers without Borders network. Most of the field offices have identified needs for educat ion specialists, but if needed, other specialists can also be recruited:East Africa: an agribusiness specialist or a teacherWest Africa: a teacher (when the Ebola threat has passed)Latin America and the Caribbean: a French-speaking education specialistAsia : an education specialist for the Cambodian Ministry of EducationMiddle East: an Arabic-speaking education specialist for a refugee campRights- holders /beneficiaries are teachers and staff working in e.g. training centers in refugee camps, vocational trai ning students, children in need of specialised education, farmers.Implementing partners:FCA regional offices and their local partners.

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Media Reflecting Human Rights and Democracy in East African Conflicts

description.narrative: The Media Reflecting Human Rights and Democracy in East African Conflicts project will produce a series of 20 radio programmes under the same title for radio Robin Hood (Turku 915 MHz). Each 30-minute programme is broadcasted in both Finnish and English al so on Robin Hood website (www.radiorobinhood.fi/projektit) and in Lahiradio (Helsinki 1003 MHz) and radio Moreeni (Tampere 984 MHz). The programme series will have its own blog and Facebook page for additional information and listener feedback. It is produ ced in English by journalist Thierry Francis Mbabane and translated into Finnish by Annukka Kolehmainen.East Africa has been a scenery of different conflicts based on e.g. ethnicity culture and regional disputes. The media has played an important role in t hem. This project concentrates on East African conflicts from the point of view of the ordinary citizens minorities and the media. How does the media deal with these conflicts and reflect them in the news both in East Africa and in Finland? How do conflict s affect the daily life human rights rights of minorities democracy and freedom of speech? What are the challenges of reporting from conflict situations? The project reflects the different pictures and perspectives given by the media on both past and prese nt conflicts and unrest such as the effects of the formulation of a new constitution in Tanzania new discriminatory and repressive laws in Uganda and the current political situation of Rwanda and Burundi. The war and famine in the neighbouring countries su ch as Somalia and South Sudan and the unrest and the Ebola epidemic of Congo also are a high concern. How do they affect the East African democracy and stability and the position of the most vulnerable groups in the society and the media?The project also l ooks at equality issues i.e equality between sexes as well as racial and ethnic social and economic equality through democracy principles and conflict management which gives a good picture of the social economical and cultural development in East Africa. H ow are these issues reported by the media to promote human rights peace and reconciliation among citizens?

title.narrative: F.a: Ebola wareness campaign

description.narrative: The development problem is Ebola epidemic which has reversed the post-conflict economic and social development in the country. The project aims to increase the awareness and knowledge of people in the communities of Cape Mount, Bomi, Margibi and Bong count ies on the issues affecting their well-being especially on Ebola, and to strengthen their ability to act in order to promote theirs, their families? and their communities? wellbeing, especially to prevent further contagion of the Ebola disease. The immedi ate objectives of the Project are 1) 1000 facilitators have participated in Ebola awareness training and gained skills to facilitate Ebola dialogue session in the communities, 2) 500 communities has received participatory community training on Ebola and ta ken measures to prevent the spread of the disease. Communities are offered awareness raising trainings on Ebola delivered by facilitators trained in cooperation with National Adult Education Association in Liberia, FRC?s national partner organisation. Othe r co-operating partners are national and local authorities, especially Liberian Ebola communication coordination group lead by UNICEF. It is estimated that the project will benefit 50000 households in 500 communities.

title.narrative: F.a: Health Security for the DIsabled Camps in the Bombali District in Northern SIerra Leone

description.narrative: Healthsecurity -project with Ebola added while processing. Staff of POPDA DPO and experts from local hospital train PWDs, polio, amputees(war victims) and blind ones in three disabled camps how to avoid malari, cholera, typhoid and ebola. Local languages a nd drama are used. Medical inspections are made and adviced how to use health servicies. Radioprograms about UN Disability Convention Healt paragram are broadcasted. PWDs and their families learn to take care of their health and to demand equal health serv ices with other citizens. 200 PWDs area reached by the program.

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC); UNHCR/ Humanitarian aid

description.narrative: 1.5 million euros is suggested to UNHCR operation in the Democratic Republic of Kongo (DRC). The humanitarian situation in DRC worsened in 2018 as a result of new violent clashes and an ebola outbreak that has been the second worst in modern history. There are 4.5 million internally displaced persons in DRC and 800000 refugees have fled to neighboring countries. The UNHCR delivers emergency kits to those forcibly displaced and advocates for increased inclusion of IDPs and refugees in the national system. Co ntinuous underfunding of the DRC operation makes it difficult for the UNHCR to focus on long-term projetcs instead of life-saving assistance.

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: IFRC and FRC humanitarian operations 2019

description.narrative: MFA will provide funding for the Finnish Red Cross FRC for supporting the Ebola operation of the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies IFRC in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The funding for the operation is 700 000 euros. The IFRC response aims to support 57 million people in Eastern DRC with a specific focus on five thematic pillars: 1. risk communication and community engagement and accountability 2. infection prevention and control and support to health facilities and at community level 3. safe and dignified burials including community-based harm reduction approaches to safer burials in inaccessible communities 4. psychosocial support as well as 5. capacity strengthening of the DRC/RC. The FRC will support the operation w ith funds and material in-kind support.

reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Humanitaarinen; UNHCR; Kongon demokraattinen tasavalta
Humanitarian Assistance; UNHCR; Democratic Republic of Congo

description.narrative: Kongon demokraattisen tasavallan tilanne heikentyi vuonna 2018 uusien vakivaltaisuuksien ja historian toiseksi suurimman ebola-epidemian takia. Maassa on noin 45 miljoonaa sisaisesti siirtymaan joutunutta jonka lisaksi yli 890 000 kongolaista on paennut na apurimaihin. Humanitaarisen avun tarpeessa on kaiken kaikkiaan yli 156 milj. ihmista. UNHCR toimittaa pakkomuuttaneille hataaputarvikkeita ja pyrkii parantamaan pakolaisten huomioimista kansallisessa politiikassa. Jatkuva alirahoitus vaikeuttaa jarjeston k eskittymista pitkaaikaisiin kehitystoimiin.

The humanitarian situation in DRC is severe and has since 2019 as a result of new violent clashes and an ebola outbreak that has been the second worst in modern history. There are approximately 4.5 million internally displaced persons in DRC and over 89000 0 refugees have fled to neighboring countries. The UNHCR delivers emergency kits to those forcibly displaced and advocates for increased inclusion of IDPs and refugees in the national system. Continuous underfunding of the DRC operation makes it difficult for the UNHCR to focus on long-term projects instead of lifesaving assistance.

reporting-org.narrative: Handicap International Federation

title.narrative: Improving the management of ambulance fleet to support the Ebola response in Western Area

description.narrative: Fleet management of 16 to 30 ambulances which are under the responsibility of the Western Area EVD Response Center (WAERC) (16 in constant use + 14 added during the 2 weeks surge). This includes: fuelling, decontamination, washing, maintenance and repair, tracking. Logistical support to operations including: securing and managing the depot for the ambulances, transport and storage of personal protective equipment (PPE), chlorine and sprayer equipment, provision of water for car washing and for decontamination activities, provision of diesel for incinerator and log base generator, etc. Supply of material to ambulance crews, house decontamination crews and ambulance cleaners. Follow up of presence, of refresh training needed, and payment of hazard pay for 16 to 30 ambulance crews (1 driver/1 nurse), 16 to 30 sprayers for house decontamination and 30 cleaners for ambulance decontamination and washing (15 cleaners at Hastings and 15 at the fire station during the surge). Organisation of decontamination crews for house decontamination with sprayers after the removal of a patient from his house. Provision and payment of 16 to 30 motorcycles drivers (‘okadas’) trained to spray and 70 okada drivers in charge of carrying the swabbers. ;

title.narrative: Core Contribution (CVC) to World Health Organisation (WHO) 2016-2020

description.narrative: This programme aims to support WHO reforms that take WHO towards organisational excellence, allowing it to: better deliver value for money; better deliver its global mandate of international health leadership; and ultimately to deliver better health results on the ground for all UK investments. The main areas of WHO organisational reform which the programme seeks progress on are: risk and financial management; transparency; value for money; budgets focussed on key priorities; partnership and effective leadership The programme will also have a focus on an improved WHO response to health emergencies and outbreaks (such as Ebola, Yellow Fever and Zika), reducing the risk to the UK.

reporting-org.narrative: Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

title.narrative: UK investment in Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance (2016-2020)

description.narrative: Gavi supports vaccine delivery in 68 of the world's poorest countries reaching 60% of the world's birth cohort. Gavi immunises children against vaccine preventable diseases including measles, rubella, meningitis, cervical cancer, pneumonia and diarrhoea. Gavi has played a significant role in the recent halving of global child mortality. Over the 2016 to 2020, Gavi will fully deliver the UK target to immunise 76 million children and save 1.4 million lives. Gavi targets reaching those in hard to reach areas, the poorest, and the most marginalised. Gavi has a major global market shaping role for vaccines, negotiating lower prices for low-income countries, and incentivising new vaccines such as for Ebola and Malaria.

title.narrative: Epidemics and Global Health Security Research Programme (Epidemics and GHS)

description.narrative: This programme will accelerate research and development for disease outbreaks (such as COVID19, Ebola etc) with the goal of preventing and tackling epidemics, saving lives and improving global health security. The programme will support the development of new vaccines, diagnostics and treatments for epidemic diseases and provide better evidence about outbreak diseases, to inform more effective preparedness and response activities.
